newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Hill Samuel sells Macquarie stake.
newsitem.headline: Hill Samuel sells Macquarie stake.

text.p: Lloyds TSB Plc's investment bank unit Hill Samuel had sold all its 13.4 percent stake in Australia's Macquarie Bank Ltd to the Brunei Investment and Commercial Bank (BICB), Macquarie said on Tuesday.
BICB is a wholly owned by the government-owned Brunei Investment Agency.
Macquarie said the BICB bought 19.957 million shares or 13.4 percent of Macquarie's shares at A$7.60 per share.
"Hill Samuel and BICB have also agreed to share equally the bank's interim dividend which was declared on November 19 at 18 cents per fully paid ordinary share," Macquarie said.
The transaction had been approved by the Australian government.
Macquarie Bank managing director Allan Moss said Macquarie had developed a good relationship with the Brunei Investment Agency and its senior management.
"We are delighted that they have become associated with the bank as a major shareholder, and we are confident that BICB will prove to be a constructive and long term investor in Macquarie."
The BICB would be Macquarie's largest individual shareholder.
Macquarie said it had invited the BICB to be represented on the bank's board.
Macquarie's shares were trading six cents higher at A$8.80 at 10.55 a.m. (2355 GMT).
